title: The St. Lawrence International Film Festival
text:
The St. Lawrence International Film Festival Tools 
  14, 2015 at 3:33 PM   14, 2015 at 3:43 PM EDT I am trying something new, live interviews (unedited) with local artists and entertainers and art supporters. Here is my first attempt. Click above to play vidoe. An interview (part two of three) with Adam Paul, Executive Director of the St. Lawrence International Film Festival. Here we discuss the opening night Gala, how to attend films and the festival overall. To watch trailers of films in the festival and other great video, including a great promo from film and television star, Mark Valley, click on the St. Lawrence International Film Festival You Tube Channel. Please ignore or laugh at any fun on air technical snafus. Also be aware that the still image at the beginning is quite lengthy before the video begins. Contest: A Chance to win 2 Free Passes (valued at $75 each) to the festival by finding this article/interview on our 7News Face Book Page . You can win by liking the story or by posting a comment to this questions. Is there a movie that has had a great impact on your life? Here are the rules and regulations: Craig’s To Do List: St. Lawrence International Film Festival Free Pass Giveaway Rules and Regulations No purchase necessary. Void where prohibited. All federal, state and local regulations apply. How to Enter: Craig’s To Do List/St. Lawrence International Film Festival Free Pass Giveaway Contest Dates: Contest dates are October 7 – October 21, 2015 How to Win: One (1) winner will be selected in a random drawing. The winner will be awarded a pair of passes to the Saint Lawrence International Film Festival. Judges decisions are final. All Prize winners must meet the Eligibility and Prize Redemption/Claim/Releases requirements outlined herein. Prize: The prize/prizes consist of: 2 passes value of $75 apiece for a total of $150. Winner may be responsible for pickup/collection of the prize on October 22 nd . The winner will be chosen randomly from Facebook users who like and/or comment on a weekly video interview with Executive Director Adam Paul of the Saint Lawrence Film Festival. There will be three interviews in total, titled Adam Paul Interview Part One, Part Two and Part Three. The winner can be chosen from any of the three posts. Participants can like or post on all three interviews. The Winner will be notified via private message on Facebook. The prize winner/winners must meet the Eligibility and Prize redemption/Claim/Releases requirements outlined herein. All parties assume no liability or responsibility in connection with the use of any prize awarded hereunder or in connection with any warranty or representation regarding the prize. The number of contest entries received determines the odds of winning. Drawing dates for this contest will October 22, 2015. Unclaimed prizes will be forfeited. Winners must complete a signed affidavit of eligibility and liability/publicity release. To meet federal tax regulations, the winner of some prizes may have to provide his or her social security number and is responsible for all taxes associated with the prize. Prizes are considered income and taxes on all prizes are the sole responsibility of the prizewinner. Compliance with all applicable federal and state laws, rules and regulations are the sole responsibility of the prizewinner. The prizewinner, by acceptance of a prize, agrees to release WWNY-TV, United Communications Corporation, and St. Lawrence International Film Festivals , their parents, subsidiaries, affiliated companies, sponsors, advertising and promotion agencies, and their immediate families (spouses and children) from any and all liability for claims, actions or proceedings for injuries or damages sustained in connection with the receipt, ownership or use of the prize or while traveling to or from, preparing for or participating in any contest-related activity. By entering the contest and winning a prize, contestants grant WWNY-TV, United Communications Corporation, and St. Lawrence International Film Festivals, their parents, subsidiaries, affiliated companies, sponsors, advertising and promotion agencies, the right to use and publicize their names, photographs, voices or likenesses and have accepted and agreed to be bound by these rules. Eligibility: Winners must be 18 years of age or older. Contest open to United States residents only. Employees of WWNY-TV, United Communications Corporation, and St. Lawrence International Film Festivals, their parents, subsidiaries, affiliated companies, sponsors, advertising and promotion agencies, judging agencies and their immediate families (spouses and children) are not eligible to participate. WWNY-TV reserves the right to disqualify any contestant if the contest rules are violated. WWNY-TV judgment as to such matters shall be final. No substitution of prizes or transfer of prizes to a third party is permitted. No groups, clubs or organizations may participate in this contest, or reproduce or distribute any portion of these rules to its members. Liability: WWNY-TV, United Communications Corporation, and St. Lawrence International Film Festivals, their parents, subsidiaries, affiliated companies, sponsors, advertising and promotion agencies are not responsible for: 1) Problems associated with Internet connectivity or system outages, 2) problems with the display/hosting of the website WWNYTV.COM and the entry form which is beyond the control of WWNYTV.COM and United Communications Corporation. All decisions made by the management of WWNY-TV are final. Official Rules available at WWNY-TV, 120 Arcade Street, Watertown, New York 13601. These contest rules may be changed at any time without notice. Official rules supersede all other published editions.
